channel.title: CVE Feed for Webvitaly -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Webvitaly -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-52125|2024-08-02T22:48:12.569Z -- webvitaly -- iframe
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in webvitaly iframe allows Stored XSS.This issue affects iframe: from n/a through 4.8.

item.title: CVE-2023-5071|2024-08-02T07:44:53.765Z -- webvitaly -- sitekit
item.description: The Sitekit plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via 'sitekit_iframe' shortcode in versions up to, and including, 1.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2023-4919|2024-08-02T07:44:52.161Z -- webvitaly -- iframe
item.description: The iframe plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the `iframe` shortcode in versions up to, and including, 4.6 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level permission and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. This was partially patched in version 4.6 and fully patched in version 4.7.

item.title: CVE-2023-27628|2024-08-02T12:16:36.639Z -- webvitaly -- sitekit
item.description: Auth. (contributor+) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Webvitaly Sitekit plugin <=Â 1.3 versions.

item.title: CVE-2023-6844|2024-08-02T08:42:07.435Z -- webvitaly -- iframe
item.description: The iframe plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in all versions up to and including 5.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-34805|2024-08-02T02:59:22.602Z -- webvitaly -- iframe
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Webvitaly iFrame allows Stored XSS.This issue affects iFrame: from n/a through 5.0.

item.title: CVE-2023-6844|2024-06-04T17:16:53.076Z -- webvitaly -- iframe
item.description: The iframe plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in all versions up to and including 5.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-29111|2024-06-04T17:57:45.914Z -- webvitaly -- sitekit
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Webvitaly Sitekit allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Sitekit: from n/a through 1.6.

item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Webvitaly iFrame allows Stored XSS.This issue affects iFrame: from n/a through 5.0.
